key_channel_insights.line_content: OTAs achieved 86.85% price parity with the website last week, marking a 4.28pp month-over-month improvement and signaling strengthened alignment.
MSE fares were lower than the website in 71.34% of itineraries last week, driving significant discount penetration despite a 6.07pp week-over-week decline.
GDS-listed fares remained above website rates in 96.04% of itineraries last week, with only 0.3% discounts and modest parity gains to 3.66%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Last week, 86.85% of routes on OTA matched website fares, rising 0.40pp week-over-week and 4.28pp month-over-month.
Routes priced higher on OTA dropped 3.67pp month-over-month to 7.65%, despite a slight week-over-week uptick of 0.42pp.
14.62% of Non-Singapore origins carried OTA premiums—nearly double the channel average—though this is down 8.02pp month-over-month.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 4.28% of routes lacked OTA offers last week, stable week-over-week (+0.06pp) and slightly down month-over-month (−0.31pp), indicating consistent distribution coverage.
86.85% of routes on OTA mirrored website fares last week, improving +0.40pp week-over-week and +4.28pp month-over-month.
7.65% of routes carried OTA premiums last week, up +0.42pp week-over-week but down −3.67pp month-over-month, reflecting reduced channel markups.
Only 1.22% of routes on OTA were cheaper than the website last week, declining −0.89pp week-over-week and −0.31pp month-over-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes achieved 77.85% parity last week, down −0.77pp WoW but up +6.61pp MoM, while OTA premiums moderated to 15.19% (−5.73pp MoM).
Long-haul routes showed 94.71% parity last week, up +1.06pp WoW and +1.64pp MoM, with OTA premiums at a minimal 1.18%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Singapore origins recorded 94.27% parity last week (+4.51pp WoW), with no instances of OTA higher pricing and limited missing offers at 3.82%.
Non-SG origins saw 80.12% parity last week (−2.52pp WoW), with 14.62% OTA premiums—down −8.02pp MoM—indicating higher discrepancy risk.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings delivered 86.19% parity last week (+2.70pp WoW, +5.81pp MoM), while OTA premiums eased to 7.14% (−3.38pp MoM).
Far-out bookings held 88.03% parity, down −3.56pp WoW but up +0.75pp MoM, with OTA premiums rising +1.82pp WoW to 8.55%.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE channel prices were lower than the website in 71.34% of itineraries last week, though this share declined by 6.07 percentage points from the prior week.
Instances of price parity on MSE rose to 28.66% of itineraries last week, marking a 6.07-point increase week-on-week.
When MSE prices undercut the website, they average a 0.07% discount, remaining unchanged over the past month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 28.66% of itineraries on MSE matched the website price last week, up from 22.59% in the prior week.
71.34% of itineraries were lower-priced on MSE last week, down from 77.41% the previous week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 83.65% of short-haul routes were lower-priced on MSE last week, a 5.10-point decline week-on-week, with an average 0.05% discount.
59.76% of long-haul routes were lower-priced on MSE last week, down 7.10 points from the prior week, averaging a 0.09% discount.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 53.85% of Singapore-origin routes were lower-priced on MSE last week, a 10.61-point drop from the previous week, with an average 0.05% discount.
87.13% of non-Singapore routes were lower-priced last week on MSE, down 3.23 points week-on-week, averaging a 0.08% discount.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 75.36% of close-in bookings were lower-priced on MSE last week, a 4.46-point decrease week-on-week, with an average 0.06% discount.
64.10% of far-out bookings were lower-priced on MSE last week, down 8.40 points from the previous week, with an average 0.10% discount.

gds_highlights.line_content: Last week, GDS-listed fares were higher than the website in 96.0% of itineraries, maintaining an average 0.24% markup versus last week and month.
The share of GDS fares lower than the website remains negligible at 0.3%, unchanged from the prior week and down 0.9pp versus last month.
Fares matching the website rose to 3.66% last week, up 0.95pp versus the week prior and 2.44pp versus last month, indicating slight parity gains.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS fares exceeded website prices on 96.04% of itineraries last week, a modest 0.95pp decrease from the previous week.
Itineraries priced identically on GDS and the website increased to 3.66% last week, up 0.95pp from the week prior and 2.44pp from last month.
Less than 0.3% of GDS fares were below website rates last week, unchanged week-over-week and down 0.91pp month-over-month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul routes, GDS fares were higher in 94.94% of itineraries last week, holding a 0.26% average premium, broadly stable versus prior periods.
Long-haul itineraries saw a 97.63% higher-fare rate on GDS last week, with a consistent 0.23% markup and a 1.21pp increase in parity share.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Routes originating in Singapore had higher GDS fares in 94.23% of cases last week, carrying a 0.25% average markup and a 1.53pp rise in parity.
Non-SG origin itineraries posted higher GDS fares in 98.25% of instances last week, with a steady 0.24% price premium versus the website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings (0–30 days) saw higher GDS fares in 94.31% of itineraries last week, with a 0.25% average premium, down 0.99pp from the prior week.
Far-out bookings (31+ days) exhibited higher GDS fares in 99.15% of cases last week, maintaining a 0.24% average markup despite a slight 0.85pp parity increase.
